items.headline: I’m a veteran, 57, and on disability benefits. How do I persuade my wife, 52, to downsize so we can both retire?

items.headline: Social Security’s COLA will be 2.8% in 2026 — first percentage increase in four years
items.summary_en: Social Security’s cost-of-living adjustment will be 2.8% in 2026, up from 2.5% this year, the Social Security Administration said on Friday.

items.headline: Beyond Meat jumps on the latest twist in its meme-stock saga
items.summary_en: Shares of Beyond Meat have been on a wild meme-stock ride recently. The meat-substitute company announced preliminary third-quarter results early Friday.

items.headline: I received an inheritance from my father’s estate, but the executor wants me to give it back. What should I do?

items.headline: What the Reagan speech on tariffs that caused Trump to cut off Canadian talks actually says
items.summary_en: The speech on tariffs from President Ronald Reagan that the Ontario government used in a $75 million ad blitz did omit a key section that calls into question the thrust of the message.

items.headline: Procter & Gamble’s stock jumps as easing of tariff effects leads to earnings beat

items.headline: Beware of this tax shock when buying a newly built home — one first-time homeowner’s monthly payment jumped $1,000
items.summary_en: Americans’ property-tax bills have risen sharply in recent years. But the newest cohort of homeowners — particularly those who bought newly constructed homes — may be facing the biggest payment shocks of all.
